museum.name: Timisoara Cathedral Museum
museum.adress: Blv. Regele Ferdinand no. 1, Cathedral basement

central.title: Timișoara Orthodox Cathedral
central.name: Cathedral
central.description: The Cathedral was built between 1936 and 1941 in Neo-Moldavian and Byznatine style. It has 11 towers with the highest one reaching 90.5 meters hosting the massive bells that weigh roughly 8 tonns. The work on the paintings could not be finished once with the building itself and lasted until 1956. The cathedral has an estimated capacity of 5000 people.

central.title: Piata Victoriei - Victory Square
central.description: Victory Square is considered Timisoara's main square. Here in 1989 the city was declared free of communism. Most of the buildings between the Opera House and the Cathedral are former palaces built during the Habsburgic era.

central.title: Opera House
central.description: The Opera House was built between 1871 and 1875 follwing the plans of austrian architects. The current facade is not the original which was severely damaged by the two fires that affected the building. The destructions caused by fire determined the facade and the main hall to be redesigned by romanian architects in the 1920s. Though called Opera House, the building also hosts the National Theater, The German State Theater and the Hungarian Theater.

central.title: Saint George Square
central.description: The square holds its name from the Jesuit Chruch that used to be there. The church was there before the otoman rule (1552) of the city and it was turned into a mosque until 1716. Once the Habsburgs conquered Timisoara the church was given to the jesuits. It was precisely its age that determined the austrian architects to demolish it in 1739. In one of the buildings belonging to the church was established the first university in the city in 1845.

central.title: Synagogue - Sinagoga din Cetate
central.description: Before 1940 Timisoara had a jewish community of well over 13000. The most spectacular of the three synagogues in Timisoara was built between 1863-1865 (architect Carl Schumann) and inaugurated in 1865. It was reinaugurated in 1872 in the presence of the emperor Franz Joseph I. The majority of the members of the jewish community left the city during the second world war or immediately after with the establishment of the state of Israel. This left the building closed most of the time and destined to decay. It was reopened in 2005 and is undergoing a long and complex restauration process.

central.title: Union Square
central.description: Designed in barroque style, it is one of the oldest squares in the city with plans as old as 1733. The monument in the center of the square is named The Holly Trinity, also known as the Plague Column and is meant to remember the victims of the plague epidemic that ravished the region in the years 1731-1738 and is thought to have killed almost 20% of the city's population.

central.title: The Bruck House
central.description: The Bruck House has been probably the most conspicuous building in the square since its construction in 1910. It is the work of the architect László Székely and it features a combination of Art Nuveau, Secession and Hungarian Folk motifs (in the form of the coloured ceramic tiles). On the location of the house a farmacy existed ever since 1828. It is is still hosting a farmacy nowadays. The house was restored in 2012.

central.title: Saint George's Cathedral
central.description: The Roman-Catholic cathedral construction lasted for over 20 years between 1736-1774. It was designed in a pure barroque style that is considered to be Timisoara's most expressive architectural achievement in this field. The suspiciously reduced hight of the towers for a cathedral is due to the close proximity of the city fortifications of the time.

central.title: Timisoara Art Museum
central.description: Built almost 300 years ago in the mid 18th century, the current look dates from 1885 and was intended to be in the form of the French neorenesaince. It hosts the permanent collection of romanian art and various other temproray exhibitions.

description.a: Working hours: Monday - Friday: 8.00 - 16.00, Saturday: 10.00 - 14.00, Sunday: closed
description.b: The museum is dedicated to the events that took place in Romania and other Eastern European countries throughout 1989. Guided tours for groups are provided in: Romanian, German, English, Italian, French, Hungarian and Serbian.

description.a: Working hours: Tuesday - Sunday: 10.00 - 18.00, Monday: closed
description.b: Established in 1877 the museum is now hosted by the Huniade Castle and a part of the former Habsburgic era city fortifications. It hosts various historical exhibitions from prehistoric times to Roman era, the Middle Ages and Modern Romania.

description.a: Working hours: Tuesday - Sunday: 10.00 - 18.00, Monday: closed
description.b: Built almost 300 years ago in the mid 18th century, the current look dates from 1885 and was intended to be in the form of the French neorenesaince. It hosts the permanent collection of romanian art and various other temproray exhibitions.

description.a: Working hours: Tuesday - Saturday: 10.00 - 17.00, Monday & Sunday: closed
description.b: Located in the basement of the Orthodox Cathedral, it is quite easy to miss and hardly ever spoken about. It is 100% composed of religious art.

description.a: Working hours: Monday - Friday: 10.00 - 23.00, Saturday: 11.00 - 23.00, Sunday: 14.00 - 23.00
description.b: One very unconventional museum, dedicated to the brands and consumer goods available during the communist regime in Romania.

park.title: Botanic Park
park.name: BotanicP
park.description: Known as the botanic garden, it is the result of architect's Silvia Grumeza ideas. The plans were first laid down in 1966, however the actual work begun only later, in 1986. It covers a surface of 9.8 hectares with a variety of 1650 species of plants and in 1995 was declared to be a scientific reservation.

park.title: Anton Scudier Central Park
park.name: CentralP
park.description: It is named after general Anton von Scudier, military commander of Timisoara and the one that decided to create the park in 1880. Timisoara has been for most of its history a heavily fortified city but the thechnical advances in artillery made these fortifications useless. By demolishing the fortifications in 1872 significant amounts of space were made available for the city administration. As a gruesome detail, a part of the park used to be cemetary for the victims of the 1738–1739 plague epidemic. The remains were moved in another cemetary once the decision to build a park there was made.

park.title: Roeses Park - Rosarium
park.name: RosesP
park.description: The park was created in 1881 with the occasion of the Universal Exhibition. It was designed to resemble an English garden with a diversity of 1200 varieties of roses. The park was heavily damaged by bombings during 1944 and required intensive rework. In 2012 it was the subejct of a new restauration process.

park.title: Children's Park
park.name: ChildrenP
park.description: Work on this park begun in 1858 but it took many years to finish, in 1891. Initially it was named Franz Joseph Park and it only became a children dedicated park in the '50s. In the period 1944-1955 soviet military units were stationed here, which led to significant damage. The current look is the result of the 2011 upgrade.

spirit.title: Timișoara Orthodox Cathedral
spirit.name: Cathedral
spirit.description: The Cathedral was built between 1936 and 1941 in Neo-Moldavian and Byznatine style. It has 11 towers with the highest one reaching 90.5 meters hosting the massive bells that weigh roughly 8 tonns. The work on the paintings could not be finished once with the building itself and lasted until 1956. The cathedral has an estimated capacity of 5000 people.

spirit.title: Milenium Roman Catholic Church
spirit.name: Milenium
spirit.description: The church was built between 1896-1901 to celebrate 1000 years of existence of the Hungarian state. Almost 4 million bricks were used to decorate the walls as thick as 3 meters and bearing a Neo-Romanesque with Gothic influence style. The two towers reach 65 meters tall and hold the 2500 kilogram bell. Here, the sunday sermon is held in hungarian, german, romanian and italian.

spirit.title: Synagogue - Sinagoga din Cetate
spirit.name: Sinagogue
spirit.description: Before 1940 Timisoara had a jewish community of well over 13000. The most spectacular of the three synagogues in Timisoara was built between 1863-1865 (architect Carl Schumann) and inaugurated in 1865. It was reinaugurated in 1872 in the presence of the emperor Franz Joseph I. The majority of the members of the jewish community left the city during the second world war or immediately after with the establishment of the state of Israel. This left the building closed most of the time and destined to decay. It was reopened in 2005 and is undergoing a long and complex restauration process.

spirit.title: Saint George's Cathedral
spirit.name: Dome
spirit.description: The Roman-Catholic cathedral construction lasted for over 20 years between 1736-1774. It was designed in a pure barroque style that is considered to be Timisoara's most expressive architectural achievement in this field. The suspiciously reduced hight of the towers for a cathedral is due to the close proximity of the city fortifications of the time.

must.title: Village Museum
must.description: The musemum is built on a surface of 17 hectares next to a small forest North of the city. It hosts the most significant elements of the traditional local villages including original buildings that have been restored. Houses belonging to the ethnic groups present in Banat, a traditional wooden romanian church and even one very old school can be found here.

must.title: The Brewery
must.description: Even though this is not the original location of the brewery, the tradition that begun in 1718 is best preserved here. The brewery is on the present location since 1750. The beer was meant to supply the austrian army and to compensate for the lack of safe drinking water.  A fire destroyed the entire brewery in 1890 and this led to the aquisition of new equipment that is still in use today.

must.title: St. Mary and St. Nepomuk Monument
must.description: The statue represents Saint Nepomuk, the patron saint of Catholics in Banat (this is the cultural and geographical region having Timisoara as its center). On the pedestal Scenes from the life of Saint Nepomuk are presented, including his death. The statue was seriously damaged during the 1989 revolution, with bullet marks all over it. It was restored in 1992 and then again in 2016.

must.title: Huniade Castle
must.description: Once the oldest building in the city, it was built in 1308-1315 by king Charles Robert of Anjou, rebuilt after the 1443 eathquake, destroyed again during the 1848 revolution to be rebuilt again into it's current form in 1856. Today it hosts the History Musem, however due to restauration works it is closed for the public.

must.title: Water tower
must.description: It was built from 1912 to 1914 and was part from a plan to bring clean water in the city and build a reliable drainage system. The drainage system built then is still in use today. The tower was designed to provide the city with clean water for four hours, should anything happen to the supply system.

must.title: Traian Square
must.description: Traian Square was designed in 1740 by military engineers and is a replica of Union Square. The Saint George church that can be seen on the eastern side was built between 1745-1755 in barroque style. The Square frequently hosts traditional food fairs and manufacturer markets.

museum.description: Orar Marti - Sambata: 10.00 - 17.00, Luni si Duminica: inchis
museum.name: Muzeul Catedralei Timisoara
museum.adress: Blv. Regele Ferdinand nr. 1, Cathedral basement

central.title: Catedrala Mitropolitana Timișoara
central.name: Cathedral
central.description: Construita intre 1936 si 1941 in stil neo-moldovenesc si bizantin are 11 turnuri, iar cel mai inalt atinge 90.5 metri. Pictarea icoanelor a fost incheiata abia in 1956 si este estimat ca poate gazdui 5000 de credinciosi. Turnurile sale adapostesc cele sapte clopote masive cantarind aproape 8 tone. La subsol poate fi vizitat Muzeul Catedralei.

central.title: Piata Victoriei
central.description: Timisoreni considera Piata Victoriei ca fiind principala piata a orasului. Aici manifestantii anti comunisti din 1989 au declarat orasul liber de comunism iar imaginile surprinse atunci in piata avand cladirea Operei pe fundal au devenit sinonime cu Revolutia de la Timisoara din 1989. Cea mai mare parte a cladirilor aflate intre Catedrala si Opera au fost construite in perioada administratiei habsburgice si aveau statutul de palate.

central.title: Opera
central.description: Cladirea Operei din Timisoara a fost construita intre 1871 si 1875 dupa planurile unor architecti vienezi. Fatada actuala nu este cea originala care a fost afectata de doua incendii, cel din 1920 obligand autoritatile sa recurga la refacerea completa a acesteia. Odata cu fatada a fost renovata complet si principala sala de spectacole. Desi denumita generic Opera, cladirea gazduieste mai multe institutii: Teatrul German de Stat, Teatrul Maghiar si Teatrul National Timisoara.

central.title: Piata Sfantul Gheorghe
central.description: Piata poarta numele bisericii iezuite care s-a aflat aici. Biserica s-ar fi aflat aici inca inainte de stapanirea otomana (1552) si odata cu venirea turcilor a fost transformata in moschee. Trecerea orasului sub administratie habsburgica a determinat redevenirea la statutul de biserica si a fost oferita ordinului iezuit. Tocmai varsta inaintata i-a determinat pe inginerii civili austrieci sa decida daramarea ei in 1739. Trebuie stiut ca in una dintre cladirile adiacente biserici, cladire ce a scapat de la daramare a fost infiintata prima universistate din Timisoara in 1845.

central.title: Sinagoga din Cetate
central.description: Inainte de 1940 orasul a avut o comunitate evreiasca de peste 13000 de membri. Sinagoga din Cetate este probabil cea mai spectaculoasa dintre cele trei aflate in oras. A fost construita intre 1863-1865 (arhitect Carl Schumann) si inaugurata in 1865. A avut parte de o a doua inaugurare in prezenta imparatului Franz Josef I in anul 1872. O mare parte a comunitati evreiesti a parasit orasul in timpul razboiului sau la scurt timp dupa, odata cu infiintarea statului Israel (1948). Astfel sinagoga s-a inchis si in timp deteriorat. A fost redeschisa in 2005 si in prezent se afla intr-un amplu si complex proces de restaurare.

central.title: Piata Unirii
central.description: Realizata in stil baroc este una dintre cele mai vechi piete din oras, planurile de realizare datand din 1733. Monumentul aflat in cetrul pietei se numeste Sfanta Treime sau Coloana Ciumei si a fost realizat pentru a aminti de ravagiile facute de teribila epidemie de ciuma care a lovit regiunea intre 1731 si 1738 si care a insemnat moartea pentru 10% din populatia orasului.

central.title: Casa Bruck
central.description: Inca din 1910 Casa Bruck este probabil cladirea care iese cel mai puternic in evidenta in piata, mai ales prin colorit. Casa este lucrarea architectului László Székely si este o combinatie intre stilurile Art Nuveau si Secession la care se adauga motive populare maghiare (sub forma placutelor ceramice atasate pe fatada). In aceasta locatie s-a aflat o farmacie inca din anul 1828 si la parter se afla si in prezent o farmacie. Casa a fost restarurata in anul 2012.

central.title: Catedrala Sfantul Gheorghe - Domul Catolic
central.description: Catedrala romano-catolica a fost realizata dupa lucrari ce au durat mai mult de 20 de ani intre 1736-1751 si 1755-1774. A fost realizata in stil baroc si este considerata cea mai valoroasa cladire baroc din oras. Catedrala are o inaltime neobisnuit de mica pentru o asemenea cladire insa acest lucru este usor de inteles tianand cont ca a fost construita la distanta foarte mica de fortificatiile de aparare a orasului de la acea vreme (o parte din ele, precum bastionul Theresia aflat foarte aproape, au supravietuit pana azi).

central.title: Muzeul de Arta Timisoara
central.description: Construit acum aproape 300 de ani, la mijlocul secolului al XVIII-lea, are actuala infatisare din 1885 in stil neorenascentist francez. Cladirea a fost de-a lungul timpului sediul prefecturii, al administratiei Comitatului Timis si chiar al comandamentului trupelor sovietice. Muzeul gazduieste o expozitie permanenta de arta romaneasca si diferite expozitii temporare.

park.title: Parcul Botanic
park.name: BotanicP
park.description: Cunoscuta ca si gradina botanica, este rezultatul initiativei arhitectului Silvia Grumeza. Primele planuri au fost factute in 1966, dar activtatea efectiva de plantare a inceput in doar 1986. Parcul are o suprafata de 9.8 hectare si o varietate de 1650 de specii de palnte. In 1995 a fost declarat rezervatie stiintifica.

park.title: Parcul Central Anton Scudier
park.name: CentralP
park.description: Poarta numele generalului Anton von Scudier, comandantul militar al Timisoarei, cel care a decis in 1880 realizarea parcului. Timisoara a fost pentru cea mai mare parte a istoriei sale un oras puternic fortificat dar progresul tehnologic in domeniul artileriei a facut aceste fortificatii inutile. Prin demolarea fortificatiilor in 1872 suprafete mari de teren au devenit disponibile pentru edilii orasului. Un detaliu ascuns este faptul ca o parte din victimele epidemiei de ciuma din 1738–1739 au fost inmormantate intr-un cimitir care se afla partial sub actualul parc. Decizia de infiintare a parcului a determinat si mutarea ramasitelor umane.

park.title: Parcul Rozelor - Rosarium
park.name: RosesP
park.description: Parcul a fost creat in 1881 cu ocazia Expozitiei Universale. A fost gandit sa se asemene unei gradini englezesti si gazduia 1200 de varietati de trandafir. Puternic afectat de bombardamente in 1944 si de stationarea unitatilor militare sovietice de pana in 1955 parcul a necesitat numeroase lucrari de refacere. Cel mai recent proces de refacere prin care a trecut parcul a avut loc in 2012.

park.title: Parcul Copiilor
park.name: ChildrenP
park.description: Lucrarile la parc au inceput in 1858 dar nu a fost terminat pana in 1891. Initial s-a numit Parcul Franz Josef, devenind un parc destinat copiilor in anii '50. Asemeni Parcului Rozelor aici au stationat intre 1944-1955 unitati militare sovietice fapt ce dus la semnificative stricaciuni. Forma actuala este rezultatul lucrarilor de reparatii si imbunatatiri din 2011.

spirit.title: Catedrala Mitropolitana Timisoara
spirit.name: Cathedral
spirit.description: Construita intre 1936 si 1941 in stil neo-moldovenesc si bizantin are 11 turnuri, iar cel mai inalt atinge 90.5 metri. Pictarea icoanelor a fost incheiata abia in 1956 si este estimat ca poate gazdui 5000 de credinciosi. Turnurile sale adapostesc cele sapte clopote masive cantarind aproape 8 tone. La subsol poate fi vizitat Muzeul Catedralei.

spirit.title: Sinagoga din Cetate
spirit.name: Sinagogue
spirit.description: Inainte de 1940 orasul a avut o comunitate evreiasca de peste 13000 de cetateni. Sinagoga din Cetate este probabil cea mai spectaculoasa dintre cele trei aflate in oras. A fost construita intre 1863-1865 (arhitect Carl Schumann) si inaugurata in 1865. A avut parte de o noua inaugurare in prezenta imparatului Franz Joseph I in anul 1872. O mare parte a comunitati evreiesti a parasit orasul in timpul razboiului sau la scurt timp dupa, odata cu infiintarea statului Israel. Astfel sinagoga s-a inchis si in timp deteriorat. A fost redeschisa in 2005 si in prezent se afla intr-un amplu si complex proces de restaurare.

spirit.title: Catedrala Sfantul Gheorghe
spirit.name: Dome
spirit.description: Catedrala romano-catolica a fost realizata dupa lucrari ce au durat mai mult de 20 de ani intre 1736-1774. A fost realizata in stil baroc si este considerata cea mai valoroasa cladire baroc din oras. Catedrala are o inaltime neobisnuit de mica pentru o asemenea cladire insa acest lucru este usor de inteles daca ne amintim ca la distanta foarte mica se aflau fortificatiile de aparare a orasului (o parte din ele au supravietuit la bastionul Theresia aflat foarte aproape).

spirit.title: Biserica Millenium
spirit.name: Milenium
spirit.description: Biserica romano-catolica a fost construita intre 1896-1901 pentru a celebra 1000 de ani (de aici numele Millenium) de la infiintarea statului maghiar. Aproape 4 milioane de caramizi au fost folosite la decorarea zidurilor exterioare, ziduri care ating si 3 metri grosime. Este construita in stil neoromanic cu influente gotice iar cele doua turnuri ating 65 de metri si adapostesc un clopot de 2500 de kilograme. Slujble se tin aici duminica in limbile: maghiara, germana, romana si italiana.

museum.title: Muzeul Revolutiei din 1989 de la Timisoara
museum.name: Mr

description.a: Orar: Luni - Vineri: 8.00 - 16.00, Sambata: 10.00 - 14.00, Duminica: inchis
description.b: Muzeul este dedicat evenimentelor care au avut loc in Romania si alte state din Europa de est in anul 1989. Muzeul asigura tururi ghidate pentru grupuri in limbile: romana, germana, engleza, italiana, franceza, maghiara si sarba.

museum.title: Muzeul National de Istorie a Banatului
museum.name: Mnib

description.b: Gazduit astazi de Castelul Huniade si de o parte din fortificatiile din perioada Habsburgica, muzeul de istorie este primul infiintat in Timisoara (1877). Expozitia permanenta de istorie contine exponate din preistorie, epoca Romana, evul mediu pana in epoca moderna.

Construit acum aproape 300 de ani, la mijlocul secolului al XVIII-lea, are actuala infatisare din 1885 in stil neorenascentist francez. Gazduieste o expozitie permanenta de arta romaneasca si diferite expozitii temporare.

description.a: Orar: Marti - Sambata: 10.00 - 17.00, Luni si Duminica: inchis
description.b: Aflat la subsolul Catedralei Mitropolitane acest muzeu este foarte bine 'ascuns' si putin promovat. Exponatele ce pot fi vazute aici sunt in totalitatea lor din categoria arta religioasa.

Desi nu este un muzeu in adevaratul sens al cuvantului, gruparea marcilor si produselor de larg consum disponibile consumatorului roman in perioada comunista face din aceasta locatie una dintre cele mai interesante incursiuni in trecutul locuitorilor orasului.

must.title: Muzeul Satului Banatean
must.description: Muzeul este construit pe o suprafata de 17 hectare si gazduieste elemente reprezentative pentru satul Banatean. Cladiri traditionale din diferite parti ale Banatului au fost de-a lungul timpului salvate de la distrugere si reasamblate aici.

must.title: Fabrica de bere
must.description: Desi aceasta nu este locatia initiala a fabricii, traditia inceputa la 1718 este continuata aici. Actuala locatie a fost aleasa abia in 1750 dupa ce alte doua locatii au fost abandonate. Scopul declarat a fost acela de a furniza bere efectivelor armatei austriece cantonate in oras dar si sa rezolve problema lipsei apei curate in Timisoara. Fabrica a fost distrusa de un incendiu in 1890 fapt ce a dus la achizitia de echipamente noi, echipamente aflate si azi in functionare.

must.title: Monumentul Sf. Maria si Sf. Nepomuk
must.description: Statuia il reprezinta pe Sfantul Nepomuk, sfantul patron al catolicilor din Banat. Pe piedestal sunt prezentate scene din viata sfantului, inclusiv moartea sa. Monumentul a fost grav avariat de gloante in timpul Revolutiei din 1989. A fost restaurata in prima faza in 1993 si apoi din nou in 2016.

must.title: Castelul Huniade
must.description: Cea mai veche cladire din oras, construita in 1308-1315 de regele Carol Robert de Anjou, reconstruita dupa cutremurul din 1443, distrusa in timpul revolutiei din 1848 si reconstruita din nou in 1856. In prezent gazduieste Muzeul de Istorie al Banatului insa din cauza lucrarilor de restarurare este inchis publicului.

must.title: Turnul de apa
must.description: A fost construit intre 1912-1914 ca parte a planurilor de a aduce apa curata in Timisoara si de realiza un sistem de canalizare. Sistemul de canalizare construit atunci este si azi in functiune. Scopul turnului era acela de a furniza apa timp de patru ore orasului in caz ca sistemul de alimentare suferea avarii.

must.title: Piata Traian
must.description: Piata Traian a fost realizata de ingineri militari in 1740 si se dorea sa fie replica mai mica a Pietei Unirii. Pe latura estica a pietei se poate vedea una dintre cele mai vechi biserici din oras: Biserica Sfantul Gheorghe, construita intre 1745-1755 in stil baroc. Piata gazduieste frecvent targuri ale mestesugarilor populari sau eveninmente destinate mancarii traditionale.
